quote_first: “Because the two curses that have struck here in Chicago arrived at
quote_last: in the morning, and damned close to that last night. Add two hours to the deaths in California to account for the difference in time zones. The curse was sent at the same time. Thirteen minutes before noon or midnight.”
title: Blood Rites
author: Jim Butcher

quote_first: It was a vast plain with no one on it, neither living on the earth nor dead beneath it; and I walked a long time beneath a colourless sky, which didn’t let me judge the time (my watch, set like all military watches to Berlin time, hadn’t stood up to the swim and showed an eternal
title: The Kindly Ones
author: Jonathan Littell
